description: From Greek ἐς ‘into’ + ἕν + πλαστικός (from πλάσσειν ‘to mould’). Coined by Coleridge, probably after German ineinsbildung ‘forming into one’.

adjectives.description: esemplastic (comparative more esemplastic, superlative most esemplastic)

entries.meaning: Unifying; having the power to shape disparate things into a unified whole.
